intro: Gastrolobium rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaved burr荆棘, is a shrub native to southwestern Western Australia. It is characterized by its small, rounded, leathery leaves that are typically arranged in clusters. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in late summer to autumn, which are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is drought-tolerant once established. The plant is also known for its spiny stems and is sometimes used in coastal or garden landscapes for its ornamental value.
